Question: What is the name of your CI/CD infrastructure modernization project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this DevOps infrastructure initiative?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority (typically VP Engineering or DevOps Director)
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What challenges are driving the need for on-premises CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Common challenges: High cloud CI/CD costs, Data sovereignty requirements, Build queue times, Artifact storage egress fees, Inconsistent performance, Vendor lock-in
Notes: Primary business driver for on-prem CI/CD investment

Question: What is your current CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Describe CI/CD platform (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps), cloud vs on-prem, and pain points

Question: How many developers and daily builds do you have?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 10-50 devs (1000 builds/day), 51-100 devs (5000 builds/day), 100-200 devs (10000 builds/day), 200+ devs
Notes: Determines build farm sizing and capacity

Question: What types of builds and workloads do you run?
Guidance: Common: Application builds (Maven, Gradle, npm), Container image builds (Docker), Mobile app builds (iOS, Android), Database migrations, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform)

Question: What are your primary goals for deploying on-premises CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Common goals: Reduce cloud costs, Improve data sovereignty, Accelerate build times, Enable air-gapped environments, Consistent performance, Own infrastructure lifecycle

Question: How will you measure on-premises CI/CD deployment success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: Build queue time reduction, Cloud cost savings, Build success rate, Artifact storage costs, Developer satisfaction

Question: What is your expected timeline for CI/CD infrastructure deployment?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-3 months (urgent cost reduction), 3-6 months (planned migration), 6-12 months (phased rollout)

Question: What is your approved budget range for CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $100K-$300K (small build farm), $300K-$500K (medium), $500K-$1M (large). Include both CapEx and OpEx

Question: What are your current monthly cloud CI/CD costs?
Guidance: Calculate: GitHub Actions $21/user/month, GitLab SaaS $29/user/month, AWS CodeBuild compute time, egress fees

Question: How do you expect developer headcount and build volumes to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current team size and projected annual growth rate

Question: What CI/CD platform do you currently use or plan to use?
Guidance: Common platforms: Jenkins (open-source), GitLab CI (self-hosted), GitHub Actions (self-hosted runners), Azure DevOps Server, CircleCI Enterprise, TeamCity

Question: What version control system do you use?
Guidance: Common: GitHub Enterprise, GitLab self-hosted, Bitbucket Server, Azure DevOps Git, Gitea

Question: How many concurrent build agents do you need?
Guidance: Calculate: peak concurrent builds Ã— average build duration. Typical: 10-20 agents (small), 50-100 agents (medium), 200+ agents (large)
Notes: Build agent capacity and server sizing

Question: What operating systems do build agents require?
Guidance: Common: Linux (Ubuntu, RHEL, Amazon Linux), Windows Server (for .NET), macOS (for iOS builds - requires Mac hardware)

Question: Do you build container images (Docker
Guidance: Podman)?
Customer Response: Container builds require Docker daemon or Podman. Consider dedicated build nodes for security isolation

Question: What artifact storage solution do you need?
Guidance: Common: JFrog Artifactory, Sonatype Nexus Repository, GitLab Package Registry, Azure Artifacts, AWS CodeArtifact (hybrid)

Question: What is your artifact retention policy?
Guidance: Typical: Keep last 10 builds, 90-day retention, 1-year retention for release artifacts. Drives storage capacity

Question: What package and artifact types do you manage?
Guidance: Common: Maven (Java), npm (Node.js), NuGet (.NET), PyPI (Python), Docker images, Helm charts, Terraform modules

Question: What programming languages and build tools do you use?
Guidance: Common: Java (Maven, Gradle), JavaScript/TypeScript (npm, Yarn), Python (pip), .NET (MSBuild, NuGet), Go (go build), Rust (cargo)

Question: What is your average and peak build duration?
Guidance: Average: 5-10 minutes typical for microservices, 30-60 minutes for monoliths. Peak builds drive concurrency needs

Question: What CPU and memory requirements do builds have?
Guidance: Java builds: 4vCPU 8GB typical. Container builds: 2vCPU 4GB. .NET: 4vCPU 16GB. Large datasets/ML: 8vCPU 32GB

Question: What storage I/O performance is required for build workspaces?
Guidance: Build clones and artifact writes: 1000+ IOPS recommended. SSD preferred for build performance

Question: What network bandwidth is required for artifact downloads?
Guidance: Artifact proxying and distribution: 1GbE minimum, 10GbE recommended for large teams

Question: Do build agents need internet access or air-gapped?
Guidance: Internet access: Maven Central, npm registry, Docker Hub proxying. Air-gapped: Artifact caching required

Question: What systems need to integrate with CI/CD?
Guidance: Common integrations: JIRA, Slack, PagerDuty, SonarQube, Checkmarx, Veracode, Kubernetes, AWS/Azure

Question: What testing frameworks and tools do you use?
Guidance: Common: JUnit (Java), Jest (JavaScript), pytest (Python), NUnit (.NET), Selenium (E2E), Cypress, k6 (load testing)

Question: What code quality and security scanning tools do you use?
Guidance: Common: SonarQube, Snyk, Checkmarx, Veracode, GitHub Advanced Security, OWASP Dependency-Check

Question: What secrets management solution do you use for CI/CD?
Guidance: Common: HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager (hybrid), Azure Key Vault, CyberArk, Jenkins Credentials Plugin

Question: Do you require air-gapped CI/CD for classified or sensitive builds?
Guidance: Air-gapped: No internet, artifact mirroring required. Common for defense, finance, healthcare

Question: What build isolation and security boundaries are required?
Guidance: Options: Shared build agents, VM-per-build, Container-per-build, Dedicated agents per team

Question: What source code access controls and authentication are required?
Guidance: SSH keys, personal access tokens (PAT), OAuth apps, SAML SSO for Git access

Question: Do you need vulnerability scanning for build artifacts?
Guidance: Container image scanning (Trivy, Anchore), dependency scanning (Snyk, WhiteSource)
Notes: Security scanning integration and policy enforcement

Question: What compliance standards must the CI/CD infrastructure meet?
Guidance: Common: SOC 2, ISO 27001, NIST 800-53, FedRAMP, PCI DSS (if building payment apps)

Question: What audit and logging requirements apply to build activity?
Guidance: Build logs, artifact downloads, configuration changes, user access. SIEM integration

Question: Do you need Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) generation?
Guidance: SBOM: Dependency inventory for security and compliance. SPDX or CycloneDX formats
Notes: Supply chain security and SBOM requirements

Question: What uptime requirements do you have for CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Common targets: 99% (business hours), 99.5% (extended), 99.9% (24x7). Outage blocks developer productivity

Question: What backup requirements apply to build artifacts and configurations?
Guidance: Artifact repository backup (critical), CI/CD configuration backup (Jenkins jobs, GitLab CI configs)

Question: What monitoring and alerting is required for CI/CD?
Guidance: Monitor: Build queue depth, Agent utilization, Build success rate, Artifact storage capacity, Jenkins health

Question: What maintenance windows are acceptable for patching and upgrades?
Guidance: Weekend maintenance, quarterly platform upgrades, security patching SLA

Question: What support coverage do you require for CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Options: Business hours (8x5), Extended (24x5), 24x7 (for global teams)

Question: How will you manage capacity planning for build farm growth?
Guidance: Monitor agent utilization, queue times, and scale proactively (add nodes quarterly)

Question: Do you need disaster recovery or geographic redundancy for CI/CD?
Guidance: DR: Backup site for extended outage, Geo redundancy for global teams (US + EU build farms)

Question: What is your preferred migration approach from cloud to on-prem?
Guidance: Options: Pilot project builds first, Phased by team, Parallel run (cloud + on-prem), Big bang cutover

Question: Which projects or teams will pilot on-prem CI/CD first?
Guidance: Pilot: Non-critical projects, DevOps team projects, or greenfield applications. 5-10 projects typical

Question: How will you phase migration across development teams?
Guidance: Phased: By team, by project criticality, by build complexity. Allows iterative learning

Question: Will you maintain hybrid cloud + on-prem CI/CD?
Guidance: Hybrid: Burst to cloud for peak demand, Use cloud for mobile builds (if no Mac hardware), On-prem for majority

Question: What training will DevOps team need for on-prem CI/CD management?
Guidance: Training: Platform administration (Jenkins, GitLab), Artifact repository (Artifactory, Nexus), Infrastructure automation

Question: Do you need operational runbooks for CI/CD administration?
Guidance: Runbooks: Agent provisioning, Build troubleshooting, Artifact cleanup, Disaster recovery, Security patching

Question: What are your current annual cloud CI/CD costs?
Guidance: Calculate: Runner minutes, artifact storage, egress fees. GitHub Actions $21/user/month baseline, AWS CodeBuild $0.005/min
Notes: ROI baseline for cost comparison analysis

Question: What artifact download egress fees do you incur?
Guidance: Cloud artifact egress: $0.09/GB (AWS S3), $0.12/GB (Azure), $0.12/GB (GCP). Large artifacts incur significant costs
Notes: Hidden cloud costs that on-prem eliminates

Question: What ROI timeline and payback period are you targeting?
Guidance: On-prem CI/CD: 18-36 month payback typical vs cloud. Operational efficiency also delivers value

Question: Do you have preferences or constraints around CapEx vs OpEx spending?
Guidance: On-prem: CapEx upfront, lower ongoing OpEx. Cloud: OpEx only. Consider budget approval processes
